https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/65761/ : SUCCESS
8-0050 is coming from the user's input. there wont be any confusion in providing such names.
says merge conflict, Please fix it
can we say it as HEX_FILE?

enum says as file type, currently its text file. we might get a req in future to have TEXT_IN_ASCII,a binary file etc,. so I need the word TEXT to avoid confusion.
TEXT_IN_HEX says the file type is text and its contents are in hex.

do we still want user to provide us offset value??
We decided to take care of this internally.

we can't remove offset now. it might break the existing user. we have an issue to track https://github.com/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/issues/10 . we need to fix vpd-manager, vpd-parser code to get offset from json for redundant eeprom
can we call it hexFile? if yes, we can provide the same name as a flag

its a text file, its extension is .txt and not .hex. so I gave like this. 
In what way you think it will be confusing to the user?

we are checking in  multiple API, can we move it to another interface, like verifyKeyword().
And may be execute it verifyKeyword() first, independent of what operation we are going to do.

The file name looks overly complicated.
Lets use the format:
<inventory_name(last past of inventory path)>_<recordName>_<kwdName>.txt

For eg for motherboard VINI #k

motherboard_VINI_#k.txt.

Please also update the code accordingly.

why you see it as complicated?
the prefix says the file is from vpd-tool-read option.

and this option can be used for any keywords. so we need record name too.

I don't find problem having a detailed file name.


and vpd-tool differentiates output read from cache and read from hardware.
if its read from hardware, the file name will be - vpd_tool_read_8-0050_PSPD_#D.txt
and if its read from cache file name will be vpd_tool_read_motherboard_PSDP_#D.txt

The reason being the this file can only be generated by vpd tool , why do you need to specify that , also 8-0050 does not make sense to any individual. I would still agree on adding the name of the application and the option to a file. I would still keep it simple as asked above
What if the string is empty?
empty string or invalid keyword - will get captured when making dbus call to read that keyword
lets start using string_view in place of const std::string&.
Do we need to have this copy?
for new addition atleast lets avoid including namespace at the top..
A bit curious here. why do we need to convert the value to fs::path when string used initially and suffice the requirement for this flow.
Please avoid these kind of string copies. Since its a r-value, you can always use a const reference.
Please ignore the comment as I can see that the value is being updated.

I am a bit curious here. If the string is not found std::string::npos will be returned which is (-1) in that case I assume it will enter the if block.
Please verify.

suggestion:
For simplicity always compare with string::npos.
Please provide an empty line between blocks of code.

Why you need to return int if you just have to return 0/1.
Use bool instead.
Query: If this fails do you need to have any cout?
its good to have. added it.

Please use bool if you want only 1/0 to detect function failure/success.
bool is 1 byte, int is 4 bytes (on 32bit system).
We dont need this. Lets discuss.

I would suggest to keep this. anyways we need to have a variable to hold the file type.
in that case, having a bool type variable doesn't make sense ( bool textFile = true/false ). 
so its better to have enum.
Can have only "input" variable rather, with "input" updated above.
This is there when file is_open fails. The message does not convey the cause properly.

Ideally "1" should be returned for success and "0" should be returned as failure (apart from main function) so that the function can be evaluated in a "if" condition.
If there is no specific need please switch the values.
yeah.. changed it to true and false to avoid confusion.
Use const reference as this value is not suppose to change in the function.
Why this copy is required? please have this check in place.
this is returning to the caller in vpd_tool.cpp , that is getting returned as rc from main. so having 0 for success and 1 for failure works here.
I am curious why this function needs to return fs::path and the function needs fs::path as parameter. Why can't we use standard string?

> function needs fs::path
I meant function "stringToFile" needs fs::path.
These are unnecessary noise. Please check.
For consistency across file, please use out.

Will need more information here.
For what the keyword is being verified or why it is being verified.
Why have you added this header if you are not using string_view in your code.
Jinu: Use constants instead of magic number/symbols
nit D should be in capitals.
In return please mention that it will also return the same value as input in case if/else if fails.
even if if..else fails, we still return the dbus name only for the given keyword right?
Jinu: No differentiation required as we are only having one type of file.
Jinu: No need for this flag as there is only one type of file now.
What is 2 digit hex format. Also this complete description need to go away if we agree to remove the -t flag.
In case the above comment prevails, this code becomes moot.
Jinu: need to discuss file name.
Could you change this to something like writeStringValueIntoFile.
Please use a constant reference if you are not going to modify this value.
Jinu: Binary not to be supported, please update.
Add more description please about which path.
There are lot of unwanted changes in the commit. Please look into that.
Please have error handling in case of rfind as well, goes for line number 49 as well.

If you are closing here, you should close after line 110 as well. 
BTW you can also get rid of close, It will close when the object goes out of scope.

You call, if you want have it at both the places or remove completely.

If the stream is currently not associated with any file (i.e., no file has successfully been open with it), calling this function fails. https://cplusplus.com/reference/fstream/fstream/close/ 

So its not required to close after line 110

Why this needs to be added? Your previous logs will have std::endl shouldn't that take care.
We are mixing c and c++ types.
Same here, don't mix c and c++ type and please check do we actually need a new line before every log where every log is also has std::endl;
Please check why these has been modified. I don't see any change here.
Query: What is this file? Same at 51 and 62. This was not there in previous commits.

if we fail to parse the inventory path for some reason, we still need to continue providing a file path. so we will go with output.txt in such cases. Anyways at the end of the execution we will tell the user about the output file path. So this shouldn't be an issue.

Please don't  mark as resolved if you are not fixing as requested or disagree with the comment as it does not show up in the next PS and it is difficult to track. Just reply why you dis-agree. Once we reach a conclusion we can close.

Now, I am still not convinced, if it is ok to just give any file name in case of any situation. Why do we need to do all those math in normal case? Why can't we return a simple file name there itself and if those checks are important then why in case of any error situation we are just overlooking them and proceeding further.
am not sure why am getting all these unrelated changes after running clang.
Have a cout here atleast, empty block does not make sense.

ok. I thought why to display the error message, as anyways we print the vpd-tool output with Present set to unknown.
But now I think its ok to display both error msg and the the vpd-tool output, so atleast we get an idea of what went wrong.
Please look at all the places where you have changes in this commit and remove this.
Why we need a cout here? If nothing failed it is obvious that data got updated. Lets keep logging limited to error handling.
this is required to indicate the user that from vpd-tool side updation is successful and done.

Please dont miix "\n" and endl.
Please follow c++ type and we dont need \n at the beginning f the statement.
Why are you changing code unrelated to your commit? It will create unnecessary confusion.
all these are clang issue. am not sure why these are getting changed unnecessarily
why is it required for large ones and not small ones? remove

what do you mean by "pipe to text file"?

Why text file and not just file
why is the error given in commit message?
Can you please rename this function name as getDbusNameForGiveKw, this sounds better I feel.
"ThisKw" denotes the keyword taken as input parameter. both the names suits this. I prefer not to change.
"GivenKw" more suitable than "ThisKw" I feel, so better change as GivenKw,  as Kw is passed/Given by the caller to get the name of the Dbus for the passed Kw.
As discussed please go ahead with the name "ThisKw"
Can you please rename this function name as getDbusNameForGiveKw, this sounds better I feel.
"ThisKw" denotes the keyword taken as input parameter. both the names suits this. I prefer not to change.
"GivenKw" more suitable than "ThisKw" I feel, so better change as GivenKw,  as Kw is passed/Given by the caller to get the name of the Dbus for the passed Kw.
As discussed please go ahead with the name "ThisKw"
why this new flag , can awe not use the below --file?
this could have been used with read flag option

If that is the case, why it was not there before, Why this information is now required? 
Also in case of any error exception is being thrown, if it is not there, its implicit that all went well. Can there be a third scenario?

Again please don't mark resolve if you don't agree to make the change as suggested.
I would like to keep this print
to notify the user that data has been successfully updated.
Are these test couts? Because there is no point having these
Move it back how it was in base then clang will not rearrange it.
this line is in clang format. The base one was not in clang format.
still not convinced if we need this

Why this change?
Empty string is taken care by the string constructor. You don't have to explicitly have that.
It is one's choice to define it their own way. A change just to add {} does not make sense.
was adding couts and forgot to remove this line. will remvoe it
You can form this string in place. Why copy?
This change again takes back to the previous discussion where in case "if" fails at line 382. You end up passing empty presence.

right. I'll initialise the string using "Unknown".

but line 389 is of no use and as per your previous comment catch block will be empty if I remove the line.

my call is to assign presence=unknown at both the places line 375 and 389. let me know if you have any concerns
Can you please change this function name as getDbusNameForGivenKw, this sounds better instead of ThisKw.
As discussed please go ahead with ThisKw

a) What are these magic numbers?
b) How did you reach to these values?
c) Why not adding timeout to the call API itself? 
d) Handle exception in case of failure required?
e) Why this was needed in this case? A brief comment would help.

a) Its the timeout in microseconds. Will update in code.

b) while trying to update 10kbytes of data, it took around 50 seconds. 
time vpd-tool -w -O /system/chassis/motherboard -R PSPD -K "#D" --file /tmp/output.txt

Data updated successfully

real	0m49.564s
user	0m0.047s
sys	0m0.009s

Here for safer side am providing 60seconds to reach timeout.

c) right. have added it.

d) yes. added it.

e) added.
I don't understand this test case
am trying to write first few bytes to hardware
where is the time for this ?

no reason :)
I prefer not to remove anything now.
would this not change as valOption is not required.

here we can either get --value or --file as input.
I checked if CLI supports either or option, but its not.
Isn't it just a description where you could mention either value or file needs to be used in a bracket ?
why the usage is not specified here ? as seen in other flags?
valid file with absolute path in --file
is this ok or you need to check is_open ?
this should take care whether the file which is already opened at line 29, exist or not.
How do you know this failed or not ?

whatever the issue, either eof reached or failed to extract data, std::getline sets the eofbits and fail bits respectively and returns.
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/getline

whatever characters the get_line extracted, only those will be processed.
should I need to check if(eofbit set and fail bit not set) after while loop?
That is my issue , should we go ahead and write only half or nothing if full data is provided or fail, letting the user know that data could not be retrieved from the file.
is this required, isn't the file path a class variable ?
How do you know if this failed or not ?

taken from cplusplus.com
Any exception thrown by an internal operation is caught and handled by the function, setting badbit. If badbit was set on the last call to exceptions, the function rethrows the caught exception. https://cplusplus.com/reference/ostream/ostream/write/

so again we need to check on the badbits or fail bits to know if something went wrong or not. is that required?
the exception will only be thrown if "If badbit was set on the last call to exceptions", else how will you know if the call failed ?
Shouldn't this be done only of opened ?
at line 63, the constructor takes care of opening the file if exist. so the file is already opened.
I meant on an exception you miss closing it , based on when the exception occurs , further to this , do we even need an explicit close?
why do we need to pass class variables in class functions ?
need a new line after brief
Add a newline after params are done
please rewrite this to specify that if operation is success return true else ion failure return false
